basics.name: Adrian Kalbarczyk
basics.label: Full-stack Javascript Engineer with 12 years of experience
basics.summary:
My professional career has been split between engineering and leadership roles.

 As a full-stack engineer, I have built software using a wide range of technologies - from the first lines of code to deployment.

 As a manager, I review architecture and code to ensure best technical practices, impeccable code quality and maintainability. I increase teams' efficiency by continuously automating parts of the software development process and coach engineers in all of the above.

 I was CTO of two SaaS startups where I was responsible for turning broad ideas into user-friendly and performant web applications.

work.summary: As an independent consultant, I help software engineering teams to overcome technical hurdles in product development process. I pick the best technologies to do the job, I refactor and optimize Javascript code and fix data structures.
highlights: I created an open source query language for semi-structured data, ObjectPath (http://objectpath).

work.summary: Codementor is a platform that connects developers with top IT experts. I help clients with their technical challenges in web development, programming and DevOps.

I built an initial version of the social media hybrid app for iOS and Android. I worked directly with the client to establish detailed requirements, designed the app's architecture, built app in Ionic 1 (based on Angular.JS) and handed over further development to the client's own tech team.

 **Used technologies**: MongoDB, Node.JS, Express.JS, Ionic 1, Angular.JS.

work.company: IoT startup from the energy sector (Warsaw, Poland)
work.summary:
I worked on preparing the system for heavy load generated by thousands of devices. I was responsible for designing architecture and optimizing the amount and structure of data to limit costs of storage. I also helped the team improve on their existing data model and code base for better performance and code maintainability.

 **Used technologies**: MongoDB, Node.JS, Express.JS, Angular.JS, Twitter Bootstrap.
highlights: Prepared the backend of an IoT app to scale to thousands of connected devices.
Designed architecture to save gigabytes per minute of time series data and optimized data storage for aggregation and reporting.

work.summary:
Cloud-based MongoDB debugging and editing tool.

 **Used technologies**: MongoDB, NodeJS, Express.JS, JQuery, Twitter Bootstrap.

SaaS product that enables anyone to connect their favorite software with data processing APIs.

 **Used technologies**: MongoDB, NodeJS, Express.JS, JQuery, Twitter Bootstrap.
highlights: Built an algorithm which limits the amount of requests per given time. It was essential in tackling throttling policies of API vendors.
Managed a distributed team of engineers.
Implemented customer-centered approach to product development.

work.summary:
Asyncode Platform was an attempt to create a platform where anyone who knows basic HTML could build fully fledged web applications.

 **Used technologies**: Python, XML, JSON, MongoDB, Bootstrap, JQuery.
highlights: Created extensions to HTML that made the language dynamic.
Hacked nearly every aspect of web browser to achieve the company's goals.
Got to Chinacellerator followed by a seed round.

work.summary:
A cloud-based ERP system for mid-sized companies.
 
 **Used technologies**: PostgreSQL, Python, XML, XSLT, YUI3
highlights: Built tender management system module of the product from scratch.

work.summary:
I was responsible for ongoing analysis of the company's business processes and proposing IT solutions to support and optimize them. I managed a 5-person team tasked with overseeing the company's IT infrastructure (software and hardware) and developing tailored business software.
 
 **Used technologies**: PHP, XSLT, XML, MySQL, HTML/CSS.
highlights: Built and implemented a dedicated customer lifecycle management system - from acquisition through the website to post-sales support to retention.

awards.title: IP Mash Up Hackathon
awards.summary: Hackathon organized by Bell Labs Dublin. My team won 2nd prize.
